did.unittitle: Architectural Drawings for Kinloch 1929-1937

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Architectural Drawings for Kinloch, Accession 10551-d, Special Collections Department, University of Virginia Library

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The architectural drawings were given to the University of Virginia Library by Browne, Dalgliesh, Gilpin, Paxton, Architects, Charlottesville, Virginia, on January 3, 1997.

processinfo.head: Funding Note
processinfo.p: Funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 106 architectural drawings and one folder with the specifications, ca. 1934-1937, and undated, for additions and alterations to " Kinloch, " the home of Mr. & Mrs. Linton Masseyin Keswick, Albemarle County, Virginia, by Marshall Swain Wells(1900-1974), Charlottesville, Virginia, primarily in 1934, and John W. Stenhouse, Bethesda, Maryland, in 1937. Also present are architectural drawings, 1929, for alterations to the residence of David Patterson, Cismont, Virginia, by Marshall S. Wells(see folders 1 & 2). Architectural drawings are grouped primarily according to size and name of architect for the two different residences and in chronological order within each folder.
